docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, Jan. 7 -- In a speech today at a luncheon he gave for his colleagues from Chile, Peru and Paraguay who will head their countries' delegations to the Rio de Janeiro conference, Foreign Minister Enrique de Ruiz-Guinazu made it...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, Jan. 7 -- In a speech today at a luncheon he gave for his colleagues from Chile, Peru and Paraguay who will head their countries' delegations to the Rio de Janeiro conference, Foreign Minister Enrique de Ruiz-Guinazu made it plain that Argentina would oppose any interpretation of continental solidarity that entailed going to war against the Axis.

headline.main: ARGENTINA BALKS AT WAR UPON AXIS; Informs Visiting Diplomats of Attitude to Be Taken at Rio de Janeiro Meeting Argentina Balks at War on Axis As Basis of Rio-de Janeiro Policy

docs.snippet: Count Carlo Sforza, former Italian Foreign Minister and active anti-fascist leader, announced yesterday that he had sent telegrams to President Roosevelt and Secretary Hull pledging the support of 800,000 Italians living in the United States in the...
docs.lead_paragraph: Count Carlo Sforza, former Italian Foreign Minister and active anti-fascist leader, announced yesterday that he had sent telegrams to President Roosevelt and Secretary Hull pledging the support of 800,000 Italians living in the United States in the fight against fascism.
docs.abstract: Pledges Ital-Amers war support, wires to Roosevelt and Sec Hull

headline.main: 800,000 ITALIANS HERE BACK WAR ON FASCISM; Sforza Assures Roosevelt and and Hull of Undivided Aid

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, Jan. 8 -- Government control of all banking transactions with non-American countries as a war measure to curb the activities of foreign agents was decided upon when the Cabinet met this morning with Acting President Ramon S....
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, Jan. 8 -- Government control of all banking transactions with non-American countries as a war measure to curb the activities of foreign agents was decided upon when the Cabinet met this morning with Acting President Ramon S. Castillo.

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, Jan. 10 -- Uruguayan Foreign Minister Alberto Guani left Montevideo for Rio de Janeiro today on the United States steamer Uruguay, along with the Chilean delegation headed by Foreign Minister Juan B. Rossetti.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, Jan. 10 -- Uruguayan Foreign Minister Alberto Guani left Montevideo for Rio de Janeiro today on the United States steamer Uruguay, along with the Chilean delegation headed by Foreign Minister Juan B. Rossetti.

docs.snippet: In a large South American city, a young North American went to the home of his friend, Senorita Alvarez, for luncheon. The young man enjoyed a pleasant meal, found that his Spanish was quite acceptable to the girl's family, and noted that the hour to...
docs.lead_paragraph: In a large South American city, a young North American went to the home of his friend, Senorita Alvarez, for luncheon. The young man enjoyed a pleasant meal, found that his Spanish was quite acceptable to the girl's family, and noted that the hour to return to work approached with alarming rapidity.

headline.main: Women in South America Play Ever Widening Role; In Social Affairs, Business and Politics They Enjoy Most of the Liberties They Want While Remaining Loyal to Their Old Traditions

docs.snippet: Interest in the foreign exchange market last week centered in the upward spiral in the Canadian dollar, which climbed to 89 cents, a recovery of all of the loss sustained since the first week in November. The close on Saturday was 88.75 cents, a net...
docs.lead_paragraph: Interest in the foreign exchange market last week centered in the upward spiral in the Canadian dollar, which climbed to 89 cents, a recovery of all of the loss sustained since the first week in November. The close on Saturday was 88.75 cents, a net gain of 2 cents from the preceding week.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; WEEK ENDED JAN. 10, 1942

docs.snippet: ABOARD S.S. URUGUAY (en route to Rio de Janeiro), Jan. 12 (AP) -- "What will Argentina do?" was the one question tonight aboard this vessel bearing the Chilean and Uruguayan delegates to the Pan-American conference at Rio de Janeiro.
docs.lead_paragraph: ABOARD S.S. URUGUAY (en route to Rio de Janeiro), Jan. 12 (AP) -- "What will Argentina do?" was the one question tonight aboard this vessel bearing the Chilean and Uruguayan delegates to the Pan-American conference at Rio de Janeiro.
